author: Vikas Pathak
text:
The BJP does not believe that the violence at Kaliachak in Malda was a reaction to a distasteful remark by Hindu Mahasabha leader Kamlesh Tiwari.

“Is a reaction after 30 days of the remark a reaction or a planned conspiracy to attack a police station?” BJP’s Bengal co-incharge Siddharth Nath Singh asked.

“Malda has had a fake currency racket that the NIA had acted against months back.”

He said the ruling Trinamool Congress was trying to shield some individuals in the garb of a “riot.”

BJP leaders alleged that the mob had attacked the police station to destroy documentary proof of the fake currency racket.
title: Violence planned: BJP
